title: Aaron Paul gives Breaking Bad synopsis in less than three minutes ahead of El Camino film
text:
Who needs binge watching when you have Aaron Paul around?

Paul, appearing on Jimmy Kimmel Wednesday, delivered a three-minute synopsis of the hit series, two days ahead of the Netflix debut of El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie.

The 40-year-old reminded the audience about the storyline of the show, in which he co-starred as Jesse Pinkman along leading man Bryan Cranston's Walter White character.

Efficient: Aaron Paul, 40, appearing on Jimmy Kimmel Wednesday, delivered a three-minute synopsis of the hit series, two days ahead of the Netflix debut of El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie, which is set to begin streaming Friday on the service

'So, there's this chemistry teacher named Walt who gets cancer,' said Paul, who shot to fame on the AMC series that aired from 2008 until 2013.

The Emmett, Idaho-born actor then went over key details on the Albuquerque, New Mexico-set series, which spanned five seasons and was a mainstream hit by the end of its run.

'Walt starts cooking meth to pay for his medical bills with the help of his former student Jesse,' the actor said, pointing at himself. 'We cooked some meth in a Winnebago, I say b**** a lot, we kill some people with science.'

The three-time Emmy winner also touched on some of the key characters in the series, including Hank Schrader (played by Dean Norris) and Saul Goodman (played by Bob Odenkirk), who would go on to be the focal point of the show's spin-off, Better Caul Saul.

Dynamic duo: Paul co-starred on the New Mexico-set show along leading man Bryan Cranston

Short and sweet: Paul said of the series, 'We cooked some meth in a Winnebago, I say b**** a lot, we kill some people with science'

Up to speed: Paul brought viewers up to date where things left off in the show's finale Felina

'Walt's brother in law Hank is a DEA agent and he's after us,' he said. 'Walt hires a lawyer named Saul, who gets his own show where he works at a Cinnabon.

Paul ran down a list of the characters who perished over the course of the series, bringing viewers up to date where things left off in the show's finale Felina, as Pinkman was last seen speeding from away from a meth lab crime compound he'd been held at against his will.

'I get kidnapped by neo-Nazis, the Nazis die because Walt kills them - again, science b****!' he said, the latter one of his catchphrases on the series. 'Then Walt died while I drive away in an El Camino, which is the name of this movie, where this all picks up.'

Busy: Paul has had a steady presence in Hollywood in the six years since the series went off the air, appearing on a number of shows and in films

Lauded: Paul was hailed by host Jimmy Kimmel after his impressive monologue

Peace out: The actor donned a black leather jacket and Hawaiian shirt making his way into Kimmel's studio in Hollywood

Paul has had a steady presence on the tube in the years since the series went off the air, appearing on shows such as The Path and BoJack Horseman.

He's got a recurring role on the third season of the series Westworld, which returns to HBO next year.

El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie is set to begin streaming Friday on Netflix, and open in select theaters that same day.
